All Classes

  • All Classes Interface Summary Class Summary Enum Summary Exception Summary Annotation Types Summary 
    Class Description
    AbstractClientSidePlugin
    The class AbstractClientSidePlugin provides the functionalities required to connect a client component to a server component for given required and offered interfaces.
    AbstractComponent
    The class AbstractComponent represents the basic information and methods for components in the component model, completing the component virtual machine with operations dealing with individual components.
    AbstractComponent.AbstractService<V>
    The abstract class AbstractService provides the basic method implementations for component service calls.
    AbstractComponent.AbstractTask
    The abstract class AbstractTask provides the basic method implementations for component tasks.
    AbstractComponent.ExecutorServiceFactory
    The functional interface ExecutorServiceFactory proposes a mean to provide a factory creating executor service instances to be added to the executor services of the component.
    AbstractComponentHelper
    The class AbstractComponentHelper defines a set of static methods used in the class AbstractComponent but also in some others.
    AbstractConnector
    The class AbstractConnector partially implements an abstract connector between two components by assuming that the offering component implements the offered interface.
    AbstractContinuation<ParameterType>
    The abstract class AbstractContinuation implements the baseline methods for the component model continuation-passing style
    AbstractCVM
    The class AbstractCVM defines the common properties of component virtual machines in the component model.
    AbstractDataConnector
    The class AbstractDataConnector partially implements a basic data connector between components exchanging data rather than calling each others services.
    AbstractDataInboundPort
    The class AbstractDataInboundPort partially implements an inbound port for data exchanging components.
    AbstractDataOutboundPort
    The class AbstractDataOutboundPort partially implements an outbound port for data exchanging components.
    AbstractDataTwoWayConnector
    The class AbstractDataTwoWayConnector partially implements a basic data connector between components exchanging data in a peer to peer way rather than calling each others services.
    AbstractDataTwoWayPort
    The class AbstractDataTwoWayPort partially implements a data two-way port for components exchanging data with each others in a peer-to-peer fashion.
    AbstractDistributedCVM
    The class AbstractDistributedCVM defines the common properties of distributed component virtual machines in the component model.
    AbstractInboundPort
    The class AbstractInboundPort partially implements an inbound port which implements the offered interface of the provider component so that the provider can be called through this port.
    AbstractLocalComposedContinuation<ParameterType>
    The class AbstractComposedContinuation
    AbstractLocalContinuation<ParameterType>
    The class AbstractLocalContinuation
    AbstractOutboundPort
    The class AbstractOutboundPort partially implements an outbound port which implements the required interface of the owning component so that it can call its providers through this port.
    AbstractPlugin
    The abstract class AbstractPlugin defines the most generic methods and data for component plug-ins.
    AbstractPort
    The class AbstractPort represents the basic properties and behaviours of ports in the component model.
    AbstractRemoteContinuation<ParameterType>
    The class AbstractRemoteContinuation
    AbstractTwoWayConnector<TWI extends TwoWayCI>
    The class AbstractTwoWayConnector partially implements a basic connector between components calling each others services in a peer to peer way rather than in a client-provider relationship.
    AbstractTwoWayPort<TWI extends TwoWayCI>
    The class AbstractTwoWayPort partially implements a two-way port for components calling each others in a peer-to-peer fashion.
    ActiveDataConnector
    The class ActiveDataConnector partially implements an active connector that can be used to connect active components in a synchronised way, on a mix of active and passive components using a full or partial pull mode.
    AddPlugin
    The annotation AddPlugin put on a component definition class tells BCM that a plug-in instantiated from the given class must be added to the component with the given URI.
    AddPlugins
    The annotation AddPlugins collects a list of AddPlugin annotations.
    Address  
    AddressI  
    BadConnectionDataException
    The exception BadConnectionDataException is thrown when the data identifying the connection to a RMI registry is incorrect.
    Ball
    The class Ball define ball objects for the ping pong example.
    BCMException
    The class BCMException defines the most general exception thrown within BCM; other BCM specific exceptions inherit from this exception.
    ClientComponent
    The class ClientComponent implements a component that uses the push control of the push control plug-in to start the pushing of data from a server component and then consume these data before stopping.
    ClientSideExample
    The class ClientSideExample shows how a client component can use the dynamic connection plug-in to connect itself with a server component and call its services.
    ClientSidePluginI
    The interface ClientSidePluginI declares the methods that a client plug-in uses to connect with a server-side plug-in on a given component interface with given ports and connector.
    CommunicationCI  
    CommunicationConnector  
    ComponentExecutorServiceManager
    The class ComponentExecutorServiceManager defines objects used to manage user-defined executor services in components.
    ComponentI
    The interface ComponentI serves as common supertype for all classes that implements components in this component model.
    ComponentI.ComponentService<V>
    The interface ComponentService is meant to group under a same interface all of the requests that return results for this component.
    ComponentI.ComponentTask
    The interface ComponentTask is meant to group under a same interface all of the tasks for this component.
    ComponentI.FComponentService<T>
    The interface FComponentService is a functional interface allowing to use Java 8 lambda-expressions to create service tasks to be submitted to components.
    ComponentI.FComponentTask
    The interface FComponentTask is a functional interface allowing to use Java 8 lambda-expressions to create service tasks to be submitted to components.
    ComponentInterface
    ComponentInterface serves as a common super-type for all component interfaces in the BCM component model.
    ComponentSchedulableExecutorServiceManager
    The class ComponentSchedulableExecutorServiceManager implements an executor service manager for scheduled pool threads.
    ComponentShutdownException
    The class ComponentShutdownException defines the exception type which instances are thrown when an error occurs during the shutdown of a component.
    ComponentStartException
    The class ComponentDidNotStartException defines the exception type which instances are thrown when an error occurs during the starting of a component.
    ComponentState
    The enumeration ComponentState describes the different states in which a component can be during its life-cycle.
    ComponentStateI
    The interface ComponentStateI represents the common supertype of all states in components life-cycles.
    ComponentTaskExecutionException
    The class ComponentTaskExecutionException defines exceptions that are thrown when something goes wrong in the execution of a task or a request by a component.
    ComponentVirtualMachineI
    The interface ComponentVirtualMachineI defines the common behaviours of component virtual machines for component-based applications.
    ComposedContinuationI<ParameterType>
    The class ComposedContinuationI
    ConcurrentMapComponent<K,​V>
    The class ConcurrentMapComponent implements a "componentised" implementation of a hash map allowing multiple readers at the same time but only one writer.
    ConfigurationException
    The class ConfigurationException defines the inheritance root for exceptions thrown when the configuration of a BCM distributed execution encounters a problem.
    ConfigurationFileParser
    The class ConfigurationFileParser provides methods to validate and parse component deployment configuration files.
    ConfigurationParameters
    The class ConfigurationParameters defines objects holding the component deployment configuration parameters.
    ConnectionData
    The class ConnectionData represents the data stored by the reqistry to know for each port on which host the port is published on the RMI registry.
    ConnectionException
    The class ConnectionException defines exceptions that are thrown when something goes wrong in the port connection process.
    ConnectionInfoI  
    ConnectionInformation  
    ConnectionType
    The class ConnectionType defines an enumerated type of connection that can be used in the componenbt model.
    ConnectorI
    The interface ConnectorI is the generic interface for connectors that mediate between requiring and offering components.
    ConstructorSignature
    The class ConstructorSignature
    ContinuationExamples
    The class ContinuationExamples implements a component for illustrating the use of BCM continuation-passing style.
    ContinuationI<ParameterType>
    The interface ContinuationI extends the ComponentI.ComponentService to define a calling protocol for continuations in the component model continuation-passing style.
    ContractException
    The class ContractException defines the most general exception thrown when a contract violation occurs.
    CreateHotswap
    The class CreateHotswap allows to create the java agent required for the hot swap operation changing dynamically classes in the JVM.
    CVM  
    CVM  
    CVM
    The class CVM implements the single JVM assembly for the basic client/server example.
    CVM
    The class CVM deploys and launch a simple tests for the ConcurrentMapComponent.
    CVM
    The class CVM deploys and executes the continuation-passing style example on a single JVM.
    CVM
    The class CVM creates a component assembly for the single-JVM execution of the dynamic deployment example.
    CVM
    The class CVM implements the single JVM assembly for the basic client/server example.
    CVM
    The class CVM deploys and run the ping pong example on a single JVM.
    CVM
    The class CVM assembles the component and start the execution of the reflection example as a mono-JVM application.
    CVM
    The class CVM
    CVM
    The class CVM launches the example of a dynamic connection as a single JVM application.
    CVM
    The class CVM deploys and executes the data interfaces push control plug-in example.
    CVMDebugModes
    The enumeration CVMDebugModes defines the different debug modes that can be set on a BCM virtual machine to trigger traces on the corresponding processes in the execution of a program (publishing ports, calling methods across ports and connectors, etc.).
    CVMDebugModesI
    The interface CVMDebugModesI marks values of debug modes to ease their extension by end users.
    CVMState
    The class CVMState describes the different states in which a component virtual machine can be during its life-cycle.
    CVMStateI
    The interface CVMStateI represents the common supertype of all states in component virtual machines life-cycles.
    CyclicBarrierProtocol
    The class CyclicBarrierProtocol is simply grouping the interfaces and classes that implement a command design pattern for the cyclic barrier.
    CyclicBarrierProtocol.Request
    The abstract class Request defines the common properties of requests for the cyclic barrier.
    CyclicBarrierProtocol.RequestI
    The interface RequestI declares the common behaviours of request objects for the cyclic barrier.
    CyclicBarrierProtocol.Response
    The class Response
    CyclicBarrierProtocol.ResponseI
    The interface ResponseI declares the common behaviours of response objects for the cyclic barrier.
    CyclicBarrierProtocol.ResumeResponse
    The class ResumeResponse
    CyclicBarrierProtocol.ShutdownRequest
    The class ShutdownRequest implements a wait request sent by synchronised processes to the cyclic barrier.
    CyclicBarrierProtocol.WaitRequest
    The class WaitRequest implements a wait request sent by synchronised processes to the cyclic barrier.
    DataConnector
    The class DataConnector partially implements a basic data connector where components call each others using plain Java method calls only.
    DataConnectorI
    The interface DataConnectorI is the generic interface for connectors that mediate between requiring and offering components that exchange data rather than calling services from each others.
    DataInboundPortI
    The interface DataInboundPortI represents the category of ports used by components exchanging data rather than being called for their services.
    DataInterfacePushControlClientSidePlugin
    The class DataInterfacePushControlClientSidePlugin implements the client-side role in this plug-in.
    DataInterfacesPushControlServerSidePlugin
    The class DataInterfacesPushControlServerSidePlugin implements the server-side of a push control service that allows to start and stop the push of data via a DataOfferedInboundPort (or subclasses thereof).
    DataOfferedCI
    The component interface DataOfferedCI defines a basic interface for components that exchange raw data rather than calling each others services.
    DataOfferedCI.DataI
    The interface DataOfferedCI.DataI provides for a generic type of data produced by the offering component.
    DataOfferedCI.PullCI
    The component interface DataOfferedCI.PullCI contains the signatures of the methods that can be called by the requiring components to get data from the offering component.
    DataOfferedCI.PushCI
    The component interface DataOfferedCI.PushCI contains the signatures of the methods that are called by the offering component to send data to the requiring component.
    DataOutboundPortI
    The interface DataOutboundPortI represents the category of ports used by components exchanging data rather than calling providers for their services.
    DataRequiredCI
    The component interface DataRequiredCI defines a basic interface for components that exchange raw data rather than calling each others services.
    DataRequiredCI.DataI
    The interface DataRequiredCI.DataI provides for a generic type of data expected by the requiring component.
    DataRequiredCI.PullCI
    The component interface DataRequiredCI.PullCI contains the signatures of the methods that can be called by the requiring components to get data from the offering component.
    DataRequiredCI.PushCI
    The component interface DataRequiredCI.PushCI contains the signatures of the methods that are called by the offering component to send data to the requiring component.
    DataTwoWayCI
    The component interface TwoWayDataCI enables two components to exchange data in a peer-to-peer way, that is the two components implement the same component interface and have both the sender and receiver roles.
    DataTwoWayCI.DataI
    The component interface TwoWayDataCI.DataI is a marker for data that can be exchanged between components using a two-way component data interface.
    DataTwoWayConnector
    The class DataTwoWayConnector implements a standard connector for components exchanging data in a peer-to-peer mode using standard data two-way interfaces.
    DataTwoWayConnectorI
    The interface DataTwoWayConnectorI is the generic interface for connectors that mediate between requiring and offering components that exchange data rather than calling services from each others, but using the same interface on both sides and act as peers in the exchange.
    DCVM_Launcher
    The class DCVM_Launcher is used to execute BCM applications in multi-JVM but mono-host mode.
    DCVMCyclicBarrier
    The class DCVMCyclicBarrier implements a synchronisation mechanism, known as a cyclic barrier, in a distributed way, and to be used by DCVM to synchronise at important steps in the deployment, execution and shutting down of distributed component-based applications.
    DCVMCyclicBarrierClient
    The class DCVMCyclicBarrierClient implements the client side of the distributed cyclic wait barrier mechanism.
    DistributedComponentVirtualMachineI
    The interface DistributedComponentVirtualMachineI defines the common behaviours of component virtual machines that are deployed on multiple JVM, themselves possibly running on multiple hosts.
    DistributedCVM  
    DistributedCVM
    The class DistributedCVM implements the multi-JVM assembly for the basic client/server example.
    DistributedCVM
    The class DistributedCVM deploys and executes the continuation-passing style example on a single JVM.
    DistributedCVM
    The class DistributedCVM creates a component assembly for the multiple-JVM execution of the dynamic deployment example.
    DistributedCVM
    The class DistributedCVM implements the multi-JVM assembly for the basic client/server example.
    DistributedCVM
    The class DistributedCVM deploys and run the ping pong example on two JVM.
    DistributedCVM
    The class DistributedCVM assembles the component and start the execution of the reflection example as a multi-JVM application.
    DistributedCVM
    The class DistributedCVM launches the example of a dynamic connection as a two-JVM application.
    DynamicAssembler
    The class DynamicAssembler implements a component that creates the other components of the dynamic deployment example, makes them interconnect, and starts them.
    DynamicComponentCreationCI
    The interface DynamicComponentCreationI defines the component creation service offered and required interface.
    DynamicComponentCreationConnector
    The class DynamicComponentCreationConnector implements a connector between components requiring DynamicComponentCreationI and a component DynamicComponentCreator.
    DynamicComponentCreationInboundPort
    The class DynamicComponentCreationInboundPort implements the inbound port of a DynamicCOmponentCreator component.
    DynamicComponentCreationOutboundPort
    The class DynamicComponentCreationOutboundPort implements the outbound port of a DynamicCOmponentCreator client component.
    DynamicComponentCreator
    The class DynamicComponentCreator defines components that will be automatically added in each of the sites of a distributed component assembly to allow for the dynamic remote creation of components on the virtual where the component is running.
    DynamicConnectionClientSidePlugin
    The class DynamicConnectionClientSidePlugin implements the client side behaviour of a component dynamic connection pattern.
    DynamicConnectionDescriptorI
    The interface DynamicConnectionDescriptorI allows client side components that wants to do dynamic connections to define the way to create the client side port and the name of the class of connector to be used in the dynamic connection plug-in.
    DynamicConnectionRequestCI
    The interface DynamicConnectionRequestCI is offered by components that propose a dynamic connection through some other dynamically connected interface.
    DynamicConnectionRequestConnector
    The class DynamicConnectionConnector defines the connector for the interface DynamicConnectionRequestI.
    DynamicConnectionRequestInboundPort
    The class DynamicConnectionInboundPort implements the server side port used to request and establish dynamic connections among components.
    DynamicConnectionRequestOutboundPort
    The class DynamicConnectionOutboundPort implements the client side port used to request and establish dynamic connections among components.
    DynamicConnectionServerSidePlugin
    The class DynamicConnectionServerSidePlugin implements the server side behaviour of a component dynamic interconnection pattern.
    DynamicURIConsumer
    The class DynamicURIConsumer is the dynamically deployed version of the component URIConsumer of the basic client/server example.
    DynamicURIProvider
    The class URIProvider implements a component that provides URI creation services.
    ErrorResponse
    The class ErrorResponse represents a response to a badly formatted request from the global registry.
    ExampleCI
    The interface ExampleCI defines the service that can be called on the server in this dynamic connection example.
    ExampleConnector
    The class ExampleConnector defines the connector associated with the interface ExampleI.
    ExampleInboundPort
    The class ExampleInboundPort defines the inbound port associated with the interface ExampleI.
    ExampleOutboundPort
    The class ExampleOutboundPort defines the outbound port associated with the interface ExampleI.
    ExecutorServicesManagementException
    The class ExecutorServicesManagementException defines exceptions that are thrown when something goes wrong in the management of executor services.

    GlobalRegistry
    The class GlobalRegistry implements the global registry for the component model that registers connection information to remotely access components through their ports.
    GlobalRegistryClient
    The class RegistryClient provides a convenient intermediary to send requests to the registry and get answers back.
    GlobalRegistryRequestException
    The exception GlobalRegistryRequestException is thrown when a bad request is received by the global registry.
    GlobalRegistryResponseException
    The exception GlobalRegistryResponseException is thrown when a bad response to a request is sent back by the global registry.
    ImplementationInvariantException
    The class ImplementationInvariantException defines the exception type which instances are thrown when an implementation invariant violation occurs in a component.

    The interface InboundPortI represents the category of PortI that cater for incoming calls from client components towards the service providers.

    The interface ReflectionCI introduces the reflection services offered by the Basic Component Model.
    ReflectionClient
    The class ReflectionClient defines the component that exhibits the active behaviour in the example, calling the server component reflectively to get information and change its service implementation.
    ReflectionConnector
    The class ReflectionConnector defines the connector associated the interface ReflectionI.
    ReflectionInboundPort
    The class ReflectionInboundPort defines the inbound port associated the interface ReflectionI.
    ReflectionOutboundPort
    The class ReflectionOutboundPort defines the outbound port associated the interface ReflectionI.
    ReflectionServer
    The class ReflectionServer defines the component which is the target of the example reflective processing.
    RegistrationCI  
    RegistrationInboundPort  
    RemoveRequest
    The class RemoveRequest represents a global registry remove request.
    RemoveResponse
    The class RemoveResponse represents a response to a remove request from the global registry.
    Request
    The abstract class Request is inherited by all classes representing a request in the global registry protocol.
    RequestI
    The interface RequestI declares methods shared by global registry requests.
    RequiredCI
    The component interface RequiredCI represents the most general required interface for a component in this component model.
    RequiredInterfaces
    The annotation RequiredInterface put on a component definition class tells BCM that this component is requiring all of the interfaces given in the array.
    Response
    The abstract class Response is inherited by all classes representing responses in the global registry protocol.
    ResponseI
    The interface ResponseI declares the methods implemented by response objects.

    RoutingCI
    Interface de Composant pour le composant Node_Routing definissant quelques les foncationnalitÃ©e offertes par ce composant

    The class SerializablePair
    ServerComponent
    The class ServerComponent implements a component that offers the push control services using the corresponding plug-in.
    ServerComponent.IntPair
    The class IntPair implements the data interface required for the component data required and offered interfaces.
    ServerSideExample
    The class ServerSideExample show how a server component uses the dynamic connection plug-in to be connected with a client component and call its services.
    ServerSideExample.ServerSidePlugin
    The class ServerSidePlugin implements the server side plug-in by providing an implementation for the method createServerSideDynamicPort.
    ServiceSignature
    The class ServiceSignature
    ShutdownRequest
    The class ShutdownRequest represents a global registry shutdown request.
    ShutdownResponse
    The class ShutdownResponse represents a response to a shutdown request from the global registry.
    SocketUtilities
    The class SocketUtilities implements utilities for managing socket communications for the registry.
    Tablette
    classe Tablette qui est un nÅ“ud terminal dans notre rÃ©seau
    TesterComponent
    The class TesterComponent tests the ConcurrentMapComponent by starting several reading tasks and one writing task.
    TracerConsole
    The class TracerConsole implements a simple tracer for BCM printing trace messages on the console associated to the process.
    TracerI
    The class TracerI delcares the common behaviours of tracers for BCM.
    TracerWindow
    The class TracerWindow implements a simple tracer for BCM printing trace messages in a window.
    TwoWayCI
    The component interface TwoWayCI is meant to represent symmetric component interfaces connecting two components that can play both the role of clients and server towards each others.
    TwoWayPortI<TWI extends TwoWayCI>
    The interface TwoWayPortI represents the category of PortI that cater for incoming and outgoing calls among components that act both as clients and service providers towards each others on the same interface.
    UnknownRequest
    The class UnknownRequest represents a global registry unknown request.
    URIConsumer
    The class URIConsumer implements a component that gets URI from a URI provider component.
    URIConsumer
    The class URIConsumer implements a component that gets URI from a URI provider component.
    URIConsumerCI
    The interface URIConsumerCI defines the interface required by a component that needs to get URI from an URI provider component.
    URIConsumerLaunchCI
    The interface URIConsumerLaunchCI defines the client component task to be called to do the work in the example.
    URIConsumerLaunchConnector
    The class URIConsumerLaunchConnector implements the connector to call the task.
    URIConsumerLaunchInboundPort
    The class URIConsumerInboundPort implements the inbound port for the URIConsumerLaunchI offered interface.
    URIConsumerLaunchOutboundPort
    The class URIConsumerLauchOutboundPort implements the outbound port for the URIConsumerLaunchI required interface.
    URIConsumerOutboundPort
    The class URIConsumerOutboundPort implements the outbound port of a component that requires an URI service through the URIConsumerI interface.
    URIProvider
    The class URIProvider implements a component that provides URI creation services.
    URIProviderCI
    The interface URIProviderCI defines the interface offered by a an URI provider component.
    URIProviderInboundPort
    The class URIProviderInboundPort defines the inbound port exposing the interface URIProviderI for components of type URIProvider.
    URIProviderInboundPort
    The class URIProviderInboundPort defines the inbound port exposing the interface URIProviderI for components of type URIProvider.
    URIServiceConnector
    The class URIServiceConnector implements a connector between the URIConsumerI and the URIProviderI interfaces.
    ValueConsumer
    The class ValueConsumer implements a component that uses the integer value providing service defined by the interface ValueProvidingI by getting ten values, computing their mean and printing the result on the terminal.
    ValueConsumer.ComputeAndThenPrintContinuation
    The class ComputeAndThenPrintContinuation implements the continuation for computeAndThePrint to sum the current value with the sum of other processed values which is received as parameter when called.
    ValueConsumer.ComputeAndThenPrintFinalContinuation
    The class ComputeAndThenPrintFinalContinuation implements the final continuation for computeAndThePrint that simply output the result to the component tracer.
    ValueProvidingCI
    The interface ValueProvidingCI defines a simple service providing integer values.
    ValueProvidingConnector
    The class ValueProvidingConnector implements a connector for the ValueProvidingI interface.
    ValueProvidingInboundPort
    The class ValueProvidingInboundPort implements the inbound port for the ValueProvidingI interface.
    ValueProvidingOutboundPort
    The class ValueProvidingOutboundPort implements an outbound port for the ValueProvidingI.
